Sentencas: Achieving a high electrical conductivity with a low sintering temperature is an important goal in the development of solid oxide fuel cell electrolytes.
Titulo: Understanding the sintering temperature effect on oxygen ion conductivity in doped ceria electrolytes

Sentencas: Herein, nanoscale doped ceria materials Ce0.9Gd0.1-xBixO1.95 (x = 0 and 0.02-0.05) were prepared by the coprecipitation method for this purpose.

Sentencas: Impedance spectroscopy analyses performed at 250 and 400 degrees C was employed to calculate sample's electrical conductivity, which were sintered at various temperatures.

Sentencas: The electrical conductivity was observed to decrease with increasing sintering temperature.

Sentencas: The optimal sintering temperature of Ce0.9Gd0.08Bi0.02O1.95 and Ce0.9Gd0.1O1.95 was 1300 and 1400 degrees C, respectively.

Sentencas: It is believed that these effects results from the Schottky barrier height and oxygen vacancy concentration within the space charge layer changing with sintering temperature.

Sentencas: This oxygen vacancy depletion in the space charge layer is also believed to account for the oversintering effect.
